intro: Valerianella pubescens, commonly known as mouse-ear chickweed, is a small annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features rosettes of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in meadows, gardens, and along paths. Valerianella pubescens is known for its mild, slightly peppery taste and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
